alert.note: Alert for Haines Borough and Klukwan (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued October 13 at 1:21PM AKDT by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM AKDT FRIDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...The following area, The Chilkat River and surrounding area. * WHEN...Until 700 AM AKDT Friday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Possible isolated landslides in areas of steep terrain. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 118 PM AKDT, satellite estimates and rain gauge data indicate heavy rain across the advisory area. Minor flooding is expected to begin Thursday evening, especially near the Chilkat River. Between 4 and 7 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1.5 inches are possible. - Areas around mile post 14 and 24 of the Haines Highway are the most likely place to experience minor flooding. - For Chilkat River at Klukwan: At 12:00pm the stage was 125.93 feet. Flood Stage is 128.0 feet. At 127.0 feet: This is bankfull stage, but water can encroach the Haines Highway, south of Klukwan. Note that the Chilkat River is highly braided, if and when it shifts channels, our present bankfull and flood stages will be outdated. At 128.0 feet: Water will begin to flow over the driveway into the property of Chilkat River Adventures just upstream of the Chilkat River bridge. Additionally minor flooding may occur near 14 mile and 25 mile boat launches along with minor flooding of Porcupine Road. At 128.5 feet: Water will flood the property of Chilkat River Adventures just upstream of the Chilkat River bridge with some other minor flooding near 14 mile and 25 mile boat launches and along Porcupine Road.
info.instruction: Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information.
